title: Crate compilation hangs on release build for thumbv6m-none-eabi

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

labels.name: ICEBreaker-LLVM
labels.description: Bugs identified for the LLVM ICE-breaker group

body:
Compiling recent versions of the `rust_decimal` crate in release mode targeting thumbv6m-none-eabi appears to hang the compiler.

A bisect has narrowed it down to this commit: https://github.com/paupino/rust-decimal/commit/8f3716e38c478a454de78e6c0109fea5eea1af39

(Apologies I don't have an MCVE for this - I don't understand Rust internals enough to know where I'd start trimming this down!)

To reproduce:
  - Clone https://github.com/paupino/rust-decimal
  - Check out commit `8f3716e38c478a454de78e6c0109fea5eea1af39`
  - Run `cargo build --target thumbv6m-none-eabi --no-default-features --release` - it should hang
  - Check out the previous commit, `7d0a5c1f02066755dddc015934f0c7f7c8aebc24` - the same build command should not hang

A debug build completes in seconds.  Targeting `x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu` or `thumbv7m-none-eabi` instead also completes succesfully. This issue only seems to affect `thumbv6m-none-eabi` in release builds.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.55.0-nightly (952fdf2a1 2021-07-05)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 952fdf2a1119affa1b37bcacb0c49cf9f0168ac8
commit-date: 2021-07-05
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.55.0-nightly
LLVM version: 12.0.1
```
